title: language_test1_11
description: Read through the draft of a letter to apartment complex residents. Then go on to the suggestions for revision that follow.
feedback: The correct answer is "no change, because "“the building’s heating” is correct. The sentence should read: “As you know, the building’s heating system was supposed to be repaired today, but it is still not functional.” The letter is talking to residents of one specific building, so the word “building’s” should be singular possessive: the heating system of one specific building. To form a possessive from a singular noun that doesn’t end in “s,” add an apostrophe and then an “s.”
